update tbl_clue set fullname = #{fullname,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, appellation = #{appellation,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, owner = #{owner,jdbcType=CHAR}, company = #{company,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, job = #{job,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, email = #{email,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, phone = #{phone,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, website = #{website,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, mphone = #{mphone,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, state = #{state,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, source = #{source,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, create_by = #{createBy,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, create_time = #{createTime,jdbcType=CHAR}, edit_by = #{editBy,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, edit_time = #{editTime,jdbcType=CHAR}, description = #{description,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, contact_summary = #{contactSummary,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, next_contact_time = #{nextContactTime,jdbcType=CHAR}, address = #{address,jdbcType=VARCHAR} where id = #{id,jdbcType=CHAR}
mapper.select:
select count(*) from tbl_clue c join tbl_user u on c.owner=u.id left join tbl_dic_value v1 on c.source=v1.id left join tbl_dic_value v2 on c.state=v2.id left join tbl_dic_value v3 on c.appellation=v3.id
and c.fullname like '%${fullname}%'
and c.company like '%${company}%'
and v1.value=#{source}
and u.name like '%${owner}%'
and c.mphone like '%${mphone}%'
and c.phone like '%${phone}%'
and v2.value=#{state}

select c.id,c.fullname,v1.value source,u.name as owner,c.company,c.phone,c.mphone,v2.value state, c.create_time createTime,v3.value appellation,u2.name as createBy,u3.name as editBy,c.description, c.contact_summary contactSummary,c.address,c.job,c.next_contact_time nextContactTime, c.website,c.edit_time editTime,c.email from tbl_clue c join tbl_user u on c.owner=u.id join tbl_user u2 on c.create_by=u2.id left join tbl_user u3 on c.edit_by=u3.id left join tbl_dic_value v1 on c.source=v1.id left join tbl_dic_value v2 on c.state=v2.id left join tbl_dic_value v3 on c.appellation=v3.id where c.id=#{id}
